ygData.subject: Re: Any price recommendations?
ygData.msgSnippet: Well said.  Yes, just the sheer casting of the spells helps the castor.  And something so simple, to the mage/Shaman, such as creating food and water is a HUGE
ygData.messageBody:
Well said. Yes, just the sheer casting of the spells helps the castor. And
something so simple, to the mage/Shaman, such as creating food and water is
a HUGE deal for someone who can not do these things. And hopefully, as you
stated, when we do need some help, this person will remember our kindness
and step in and do something simple to them that is not so simple to us like
Swing that Sword or cast that Massive DD spell to save our butts in a time
of crisis.

Also, as you state, if we log or camp, the food and water we have provided
to them, no matter HOW much we gave them, dissappears, so it doesn't seem
right to charge for an intangible, especially when Server TimeOuts are still
fairly common (at least for me)

Now, binding on the other hand, as you said, is a HUGE mana drain and a HUGE
benefit to someone. You see people selling armor and weapons that they have
made or found all the time because others find that it will benefit them.
So charging for binding doesn't seem out of the question because it is a
permanent effect.

Question, does someone have to submit to being Bound or can you BIND them
without their consent? i don't knwo why you would do this, just curious.

BTW, Ann, you do belong to the EQMagicians and ShamenEQ Mailing lists also,
correct?


-->On Fri, 30 Apr 1999, Matthew Musingo wrote:
-->> Many unelightened warriors have walked up to me and asked to be
-->> binded/SOWed/get some food and water/invisible. Now, my
-->question is...what
-->> is your recommendation as setting the price on these spells?
-->
-->I have two mage characters- a 7th lvl High Elf Magician and a 5th lvl
-->Barbarian Shaman, both on the Rallos Zek server.
-->
-->With the 7th lvl Magician, as long as I have the mana and
-->the time, or the
-->extra supplies, I will summon food/water/bandages for free.
-->I feel (and
-->this is my own personal ethic here) that it is of
-->questionable ethics to
-->charge for this service. A few reasons for this.
-->
-->1. When the person camps, the food is going to disappear, so
-->it is not
-->really, IMHO, a tangible sellable object.
-->
-->2. I feel I have an obligation to help other "good" races in their
-->endevours. Providing free food and water is an easy way to do this,
-->especially when hunting out in an area removed from civilization.
-->
-->3. When I am in a jam, I don't want to be expected to pay for help.
-->Likewise, when others are in a jam, I do not want to charge
-->them.
-->
-->I have not gotten the Bind Affinity spell yet and have not
-->decided how I
-->will handle that. I think that can be looked at differently,
-->since it is a
-->huge mana soak and it is something that makes someone's life
-->easier. It is
-->not a bare necessity.
-->
-->The going rate I have seen for binding tends to fall in the 5g.
-->neighborhood, although I have seen people advertising to do
-->it for a plat.
-->
-->With the 5th level Barbarian Shaman, I will cast buffs and
-->heals for free
-->and often unsolicited. A little random kindness and all of
-->that. It also
-->helps me practice my spells and gain goodwill in what can be a fairly
-->rough neighborhood for a newbie.
-->
-->Just my two cents.. :)
-->
-->Ann
